intro: Orophea setigera, commonly known as the slender torchtree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows up to 5 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in whorls around the stems. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and often have a yellow or orange coloration. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, contributing to its propagation in its natural habitat.
